Not necessarily — it depends on exactly which “Hong Kong version” (model, ROM, region) you mean, and what terms you mean by “has Gemini, Google, eSIM, AI writing/translation.” Below is what I found. (If you tell me the exact Xiaomi model you have, I can check more precisely.)

What is known / planned

  • Xiaomi has announced that for “overseas markets” (i.e. non-mainland China) its next flagship phones will integrate Google’s Gemini AI model. (South China Morning Post)
  • Xiaomi’s HyperAI branding describes AI features like “AI Writing” (help with essays, emails, etc.), system-wide AI assistance (text, sound, image) in its OS. (Xiaomi)
  • Xiaomi’s support pages say that some Xiaomi phones support eSIM, subject to carrier and region. (Xiaomi)

So Xiaomi intends for its international / non-China models to have these AI / Gemini / eSIM / Google abilities.

What’s uncertain / what depends on the version

  • If a Xiaomi phone is the “China ROM / China version,” it often does not include Google Mobile Services (GMS) by default (because in mainland China Google is restricted). This means things like Google Play Store, Google Maps, etc., may be missing. (Wikipedia)
  • eSIM support is region- and hardware-dependent. Some Xiaomi phones in China / Hong Kong markets might not include eSIM, or the eSIM functionality may be disabled. (Klook Travel)
  • Even if the hardware supports eSIM, carriers and firmware may block or limit it. (Klook Travel)
  • Just because “Gemini integration” is announced doesn’t guarantee your specific unit has full Gemini access (voice, live conversation, full model) — rollout may be phased or region-restricted.

My verdict (based on what you asked)

If by “Xiaomi Hong Kong version” you mean a global / international model sold in Hong Kong (not a China-ROM locked unit), then yes, it is likely or intended to have:

  • Gemini / AI integration for writing, translation, etc.
  • Google services (Play Store, Maps, etc.)
  • eSIM (if supported by the hardware and carrier)

But I cannot guarantee every HK Xiaomi unit will have all those features — some may lack eSIM, or have limited AI access depending on firmware or region settings.
